content.p: Dawid Weiss, the founder of the Carrot2 project, is a researcher at the Laboratory of Intelligent Decision Support Systems, Institute of Computing Science, Poznan University of Technology, Poland.

His research interest include search results clustering, information retrieval, web mining, text processing, data structures and algorithms, data compression, linguistics, NLP. He will shortly receive his PhD degree from Poznan University of Technology, Poznań.
His responsibilities in the Carrot2 project include: project management, design and implementation of system core and components, Carrot2 community support.
Stanislaw Osinski is a research programmer at the Network Services Department of Poznan Supercomputing and Networking Center, Poland.

His research interests include search results clustering, information retrieval, text mining, user interface design and usability. He received his MSc degrees from Poznan University of Technology and The University of Sheffield.
His responsibilities in the Carrot2 project include: design and implementation of the Lingo clustering algorithm and other components, Carrot2 web application User Interface design, project website.

Other contributors:
Karol Gołembniak, Irmina Masłowska (Poznan University of Technology (PUT), Poland, HAOG clustering component, active since 2006),
Michał Wróblewski (PUT, Poland, AHC clustering components, not active),
Paweł Kowalik (PUT, Poland, Inductive search engine wrapper, not active),
Steven Schockaert (University of Gent, Belgium, Fuzzy Ants clustering component, not active),
Lang Ngo Chi (Warsaw University, Poland, Fuzzy Rough set clustering component, not active),
Julien Nioche (The University of Sheffield, UK, OpenSearch input component).
Carrot uses several open source projects -- we would like to thank all the contributors and supporters of free and open source software.
